channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Over grown, 8th August
item.description:
The bushes are super over grown and now starting to climb up my house! The nursery next door also has a constant running tap outside of the building that is making the parent puddle and now growing green moss so extremely slippery and dirty. This is also flowing into the bush area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glimpsing Green, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofa, 8th August
item.description:
This sofa was dumped in our back access at Durham Rise about 5 years ago by my next door neighbour No 19 it has been reported many times by other neighbour’s but nothing gets done, can you please help remove it as it’s attracting vermin & many cats, To get access to the back you can knock on my door for the gate key or if I’m not in other neighbours have keys

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waverley Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Crow in a parking area, 8th August
item.description:
In the given picture theres a deceased crow that seems to have died today. It is laying by White Mercedes Car near the Shell Petrol Station. It is precisely located in the entrance of Drummond Rd. infront of the Shell Stations Drummond Road Exit towards Puregym.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drummond Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste on road bio hazard, 8th August
item.description:
They keep on dumping waste water toilet water on the road i have asked them to stop and talk to theire manager they are very disminsive no english the old barcleys bank

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 260, Walworth Road, Walworth, London

item.title: Litter everywhere on the Elcot Avenue, 8th August
item.description:
Please can you do remove all the litter that's along the footpath and the sides of the roads of Elcot Avenue, hasn't been clean properly for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Elcot Avenue, Peckham, London

item.title: Children’s toys and household items left on the pavement, 8th August
item.description:

item.title: Repair of previous issue hasn't been completed to an acceptable standard., 8th August
item.description:
The kerb was previously misaligned and was causing damage to car tyres. Last week Contractors came to fix.. The work done is sub-standard, kerb is now higher than the pavement and is a trip hazard, concrete is all over the path and road and is a total mess, eyesore, and an embarrasment . Repair needs to be inspected and rectified. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Cherry Tree Walk, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy neighbours, 8th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Estate, Hackney, London
